head.title: Top Team Is Named in Bridge Competition

hedline.hl1: Top Team Is Named in Bridge Competition

abstract.p: American Contract Bridge League's Summer Nationals continue, Albuquerque, NM (S)3

block.p: A group from California and Texas won the Women's Knockout Team Championship at the American Contract Bridge League's Summer Nationals here on Friday night. The winners, by a margin of 60 imps, were Jill Meyers of Santa Monica, Calif., Randi Montin of Napa, Calif., Tobi Sokolow of Austin, Tex., Mildred Breed of Woodway, Tex., Renee Mancuso of Redondo Beach, Calif., and Shawn Quinn of Katy, Tex. The first four qualified in June to represent the United States in the world championships in Tunisia in October.

The losing finalists were Kathie Wei-Sender of Nashville, Beth Palmer of Silver Spring, Md., Lynn Deas and Juanita Chambers, both of Schenectady, N.Y., and Stasha Cohen of Glen Ridge, N.J. The first four will also play in Tunisia.

A group from California and Texas won the Women's Knockout Team Championship at the American Contract Bridge League's Summer Nationals here on Friday night. The winners, by a margin of 60 imps, were Jill Meyers of Santa Monica, Calif., Randi Montin of Napa, Calif., Tobi Sokolow of Austin, Tex., Mildred Breed of Woodway, Tex., Renee Mancuso of Redondo Beach, Calif., and Shawn Quinn of Katy, Tex. The first four qualified in June to represent the United States in the world championships in Tunisia in October.

The losing finalists were Kathie Wei-Sender of Nashville, Beth Palmer of Silver Spring, Md., Lynn Deas and Juanita Chambers, both of Schenectady, N.Y., and Stasha Cohen of Glen Ridge, N.J. The first four will also play in Tunisia.

The semifinal pairings by captain in the Spingold Knockout Team Championship are: Nick Nickell of Manhattan versus Grant Baze of La Jolla, Calif., and Rita Shugart of Pebble Beach, Calif., versus James Cayne of Manhattan. The Nickell team is trying for an unprecedented fifth straight victory.

The results by captain in quarterfinal play on Friday night were: Nickell beat Glenn Eisenstein of Parsippany, N.J., by 38; Baze beat Michael Moss of Manhattan by 3; Shugart beat Steve Robinson of Arlington, Va., by 37; and Cayne beat Jeff Wolfson of Northbrook, Ill., by 34.
